titles.title: To extend for 3 additional months the period for which chapter 12 of title 11 of the United States Code is reenacted.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.
Mr. Coble moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4718.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 6/22/2000--Introduced. Amends Federal law to extend from July 1, 2000, to June 30, 2000, the period for which family farmer bankruptcy relief is reenacted (chapter 12 of the Federal Bankruptcy Code (Adjustment of Debts of a Family Farmer with Regular Annual Income).
